results.title: Tiny world
results.creator_credit: Keith Merrill and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description: The story of miniaturisation and how far it has advanced in the United States. Miniaturisation’s tremendous impact is shown in various activities - the space program, television, medicine and other fields - and specific applications in the watch, hand-held calculators, seat belts, stereo, police communications and the ATS-6 satellite.

results.title: Seeds of a new life
results.creator_credit: Nigel Evans, Richard Mordaunt, John Bloomfield and Randel Evans Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the work of Dorothy Heathcote, lecturer in drama, and a group of her students with the mentally handicapped children and adults at Earls House Hospital. Dorothy Heathcote discusses and demonstrates her methods and the patients participate in a variety of developmental acting and thinking activities.

results.title: Seed dispersal. - 3rd ed.
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Presents a visual report on different types of seedcoats and shows how external agents such as man,the wind, animals and birds help each kind become dispersed. Depending on which season it is, this will influence the dispersal of each type of seed.

results.title: Secret world: around the bay
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Life Australia”.
There is life in Port Phillip Bay. Fascinating close-up photography demonstrates sea-creatures breathing, eating, propelling themselves and watching each other. Also shows some of the techniques of underwater exploration and some of the laboratory techniques of observing and classifying newly discovered life-forms.

results.title: Secret women's business
results.brief_description: We hide behind clothes. We hide behind hair. We hide behind jewellery. And all of a sudden none of that’s there… A warm documentary about women’s experience of their bodies in a Korean Bathhouse at Sydney’s Kings Cross. Snippets of voices slide over lush cinematography as the corporeal and the emotional melt in this bathing experience.

results.title: Sebastian and the sparrow
results.creator_credit: Scott Hicks and Kino Film Company
results.brief_description: 15 year old Sebastian thinks that he is hard done by. He has reached a feeling of boredom with his predictable middle class existence. He learns what hardship is really about when he encounters Sparrow at the local video parlour. Sparrow has more tougher trials to face, such as sleeping in clothing bins, scavenging for food and protecting himself from skinheads and the law. An uplifting story about how friendship can transcend social and economic boundaries. Starring Alexander Bainbridge, Jeremy Angerson and Elizabeth Alexander.

results.title: Second serve
results.creator_credit: Anthony Page, Linda Yellen and Lorimar Telepictures Productions
results.brief_description: The moving story of transexual Rene Richards, the male surgeon turned female tennis luminary. It is a story of deep pain, long struggle and great bravery leading to a real victory of the human spirit. Redgrave’s rivetting performance is unforgettable - aging from 22 to 54 and changing from man to woman. She imbues every gesture with dignity and truth as a transexual who did what she knew was right. Co-starring Martin Balsam, William Russ, Alice Krige, Kerrie Keane, Richard Venture, Reni Santoni and Louise Fletcher. Based on the book of the same title by Rene Richards with John Ames.

results.title: Seachange = Sea change. Series 3. Ep. 8-13
results.brief_description: Series 3, episodes 8-13. “I Name thee bay of pearls” (Dir: Stuart McDonald); Laura’s mother arrives in Pearl Bay but Laura has little time for her or her grievances, Max begins learning about Pearl Bay history and Harold is feeling his age, especially when he finds himself representing elderly drivers caught in a recent spate of traffic crimes. “Eminent persons” (Dir: Ben Lewin); Laura discovers a case of report card fraud involving Rupert, corrupt Port Deakin councillors are brought to trial - giving Max the chance to stir things up a bit, and Heather leaves Bob after he refuses to support her success at winning a prestigious real estate award. “Checks and balances” (Dir: Ben Lewin); Something is wrong with Kevin, he’s not talking, goes out of town without Phrani, and has even made it out of shorts into slacks. Meanwhile, Laura is reluctant to spread news of her impending marriage and is perturbed by her reaction to Max when he repays a debt. Max is also alienated by the town when they discover he wrote ‘Still waters’. “Love in the time of Coleridge” (Dir: Ian Watson); Max accepts a lucrative job at an international newspaper and plans to leave Pearl Bay, Trudi becomes a Vietnamese interpreter in court and Karen takes up surfing in an attempt to win back Angus. “To thine own self be true” (Dir: Ian Watson); Laura decides to tell Warwick about her night with Max, who also feels compelled to tell him about his true feelings for Laura. Meanwhile, Max discovers a plan to turn Pearl Bay into a nuclear waste dump. “Half life” (Dir: Ian Watson); Laura is suffering from the effects of a cancelled wedding, Meredith suffers a stroke which has amazing repercussions for the rest of the town and Karen and Angus have their dream wedding. Guest stars include Shaun Micallef and Mark Mitchell.
